attributes.action: Ensure ADHD diagnosis/care from GP’s is improved, available & consistent in UK
attributes.additional_details: At present the diagnostic screening and care from GPS is not only a postcode but also a GP lottery -many GPs still don’t believe ADHD is a “real” thing. It is imperative that GPs understand ADHD & its Co-morbidities. Late/undiagnosed ADHD patients are routinely diagnosed with mood disorders such as bipolar/anxiety/depression with most being prescribed antidepressants for years sometimes decades for mental health conditions brought on by undiagnosed ADHD. ADHD is a disability which needs attention
attributes.background: GPs must be well educated in ADHD and how it presents. Where patients complain of anxiety, overwhelm, depression, fatigue that ADHD be considered as a possible diagnosis and that at the same time the patient is given the Mental health diagnostic check list form that the ADHD form is presented also.

rejection.details:
We can only accept petitions about things the Government or Parliament are directly responsible for.

Decisions about training for doctors are a matter for the NHS and relevant professional bodies, not the Government or House of Commons.

Similarly, decisions about care for individual patients, including when to assess the mental health of a patient, are a clinical matter for individual GPs.

If you are concerned about the service you have received from the NHS, you could complain about this: https://www.nhs.uk/using-the-nhs/about-the-nhs/how-to-complain-to-the-nhs/

We have published the following petitions, which you might like to sign:

Increase NHS Funding for Research and Treatment of Adult ADHD And Autism: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/629854

Fund Improved Diagnosis Pathways For Neurodivergence: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/630668
